description: The department has a requirement to create a facility for generating baseline projections for its in-house dynamic computable general equilibrium model based on the Global Trade Analysis Project (GTAP) database. The baseline projections will be informed by results from a historical simulation, with special reference to areas of interest to Canada. This would have strong synergies with ongoing work at the USITC and WTO; however, it would have major separate components focused on Canada.

full_summary:
**Title**

ACAN - GTAP Historical Baseline Model Development

**Reference**

PW-22-01016273

**Amendment Information**

Amendment Number: 1
Amendment Date: 2022-12-12

**Publication and Closing Dates**

Publication Date: 2022-12-07
Tender Closing Date: 2022-12-23T00:00:00

**Contract Information**

Contracting Entity:
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (Department Of)
Address: 125 Sussex Dr, Ottawa, ON, K1A 0G2, Canada
Contact:
Tracy Langille, tracy.langille@international.gc.ca, (613) 791-7144

**Tender Description**

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) requires the creation of a facility for generating baseline projections for its in-house dynamic computable general equilibrium model based on the Global Trade Analysis Project (GTAP) database. The baseline projections will be informed by results from a historical simulation, with special reference to areas of interest to Canada.

The proposed model development will involve the estimation of a $80,000.00 commodity quantity, with an estimated duration of contract from 2023-01-06 to 2023-04-30. The timeline for delivery is from 2023-03-01 to 2023-04-30.

**Opportunities and Location**

The winner of this tender will have the opportunity to work with the Government of Canada in the National Capital Region (NCR). 

**Pre-requisites**

There are no specific pre-requisites for participation in this tender. This tender is open to all eligible suppliers.   

**’Terminology’**
In this announcement: “Supplier” or “Contractor” means the firm that submits a tender in response to this Invitation for Bids.

**General Notes**

Thomas Developments is under the assumption that the winner of this tender has expertise in Global Trade Analysis Project (GTAP) databases and are expected to perform additional work not covered under this scope, including data analysis, in-house marketing surveys, value-on-grou ng(s), all auxiliary services  Others not described.

We strongly recommend that you also review the official transcript of the full notice, as additional information may be provided there.

**Program History**

Previous call for proposals: Contender’s were requested for Historical Baseline data construction.
